We shall return! :)

This place would suit some people but didn't quite suit us. So we had to keep Lilly either outside or in our room to stop her retaliating. 
The bedroom (the Green Room) was lovely, with a very comfy bed, and we were allowed to let Lilly sleep in the armchair once we covered it in a towel to keep her hair off.
Dheera is keen for a chat and very community minded, which is great if you are keen to interact, but maybe not so good if you just want a place to sit quietly on your travels.
The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner but wasn't grotty.  For some unknown reason we were firmly guided to shower at 8.30pm?  Not whenever we wished, which is before bed and upon rising.  
The kitchen was well equipped for our dinner making, and Raj made us a cooked breakfast which was wonderful!  
The yard is spacious and this would be a great place for a dog as long as it gets on well with the two poodles.

47746652:
Our hostess Lorraine was a-waiting, and we felt welcomed from the start.  We met (briefly) other family members over the next two days.

The place – well, envisage a nice motel-room, with ES – and then, a fully operational kitchen – and then, a living room the size of two and a bit motel rooms – and then, a balcony with a vista.  Lovely, quiet; a small community that seemed cheerful … nicely modern, convenient, wonderfully clean.  We (a retired couple) only used the bedroom, but other sleeping accommodations can be made, apparently.

Nearby – Elenborough falls – a mildly adventurous (if you never leave tar) drive to the mountains, spectacular vistas along the way – and if you do leave tar, a myriad of farm roads and forestry tracks.  

From the balcony – well, wattle-birds dive into the pool and emerge, triumphantly wet; yellow-faced black cockatoos visit, plus many more for a twitcher.  At night, kangaroos visit; Eastern greys, swampies, and (I think, whip-tail wallabies).  Red-neck wallabies abound in the hills.  

It’s easy to envisage spending a week there.  I heard chooks, volunteered kitchen-scraps – and was rewarded with some home-grown eggs, which we had scrambled for lunch.  Delicious.  

And the dog was welcoming, too.  Love to stay there again, sometime…

George & Rosemary.

We wanted to explore Port Macquarie. As we did not find any place near it as we were late to select, we chose Eric's place which is a bit far from our target location. And we never regretted the decision.

Eric's place is not safe for kids who cannot talk. It was mentioned in the ad. When I requested a booking with 3 kids with 0 2 and 4 years age, Eric contacted me and raised his concerns. No Complaints as those were valid concerns. Not Eric's fault.

Once we were in, Eric made sure everything that he could possible do to support my family with 3 young children and an my elderly mother. He kept striving to support and he really felt like our own family. My Son started calling him Grandpa!

Eric's place was very neat and well equipped with our needs. A lot of room inside the house. Trancy was an amazing co-host, She cooked for us great breakfast. The place is nice and quiet with a nice big backyard. Mosquitos and spiders were visible. However, I can't blame Eric as he gave me head's up twice about the place that it is not child friendly.

We wish all the best to Eric and Trancy. This was our first experience with airbnb and certainly it will be hard to beat.

One last thing. We were interested in beautiful spots and found Forster to be much more beautiful than Port Macquarie. Just a personal thought! and Forster is not far from Eric's place!
